The #FamiliesFirst bill was about many things but first and foremost: testing testing testing. I urge Senators to pass this legislation today, to make free testing and the masks needed to provide it available ASAP. Any delay is a delay in testing.

We cannot ignore the strain that emergency situations like the coronavirus pandemic put on many families who are already living paycheck to paycheck.

I introduced the LIFT Act to give working families up to $500 a month. We need it now more than ever.

-get every small business in America with 500 workers or less

-cash to make payroll for 6 weeks that doesn’t have to be paid back

We must waive all student loan payments for the duration of this emergency.

Good. Now we must suspend student loan payments.

Suspending interest does nothing if people still have to pay out the same amount in principal.

We need to suspend student loan *payments* for 3-6 months to give people wiggle room to afford food & necessities. https://twitter.com/yamiche/status/1239944530675355649 QT @Yamiche HUGE.

Treasury Sec Steve Mnuchin: "We are looking at sending checks to Americans immediately...Americans need cash now and the president wants to get cash now. And I mean now, in the next two weeks."

How much?

Mnuchin: Discussing details w/ GOP senators. We like idea of $1K.

Encouraged to see leaders coming together around actions that will lift up Americans. This will help provide a little certainty to families and workers in this challenging time. https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/17/coronavirus-government-payments-checks-133994

I'm in DC waiting to vote on the emergency coronavirus bill the House already passed. We need to pass it and we need to do it now. The American people cannot wait. https://onairwithryan.iheart.com/content/2020-03-17-senator-kamala-harris-answers-all-our-coronavirus-questions-concerns/

We must continue to do everything we can to #FlattenTheCurve. The more we distance ourselves and limit exposure, the more prepared our hospital system can be. Social distancing will help save lives. https://twitter.com/voxdotcom/status/1239701755677609984 QT @voxdotcom Taking measures to limit the spread of Covid-19, like closing schools and canceling events, may seem drastic when few people in a city are infected. 

But early in the outbreak is exactly when such measures are most effective. This chart explains why. https://trib.al/bBpEilN http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETROLThWkAAH1yd.jpg

Congress must set up an oversight body, modeled on the Congressional Oversight Panel and the SIGTARP program for the bank bailout, but with real funding & subpoena power. We need real accountability to make sure these conditions are met.

This must be a moment in which people ask fundamental questions about the rationality of our current health care system, which exists to make corporations as much profit as possible, regardless of the consequences.

Domestic workers and caregivers are on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic. Many of them are women or people of color who do not have basic protections like paid sick days. Congress must make sure they’re supported during this difficult time.
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/09/opinion/protect-caregivers-from-coronavirus.html

The auto loan market looks a lot like it did before the 2008 crisis, with high debt & record delinquencies. We cannot tolerate this kind of racism—especially at this moment.

Now is not that time. 

But we can’t change the past. We can only influence the future.
